text:
Electronic Conveyancing National Law (Tasmania)

The Electronic Conveyancing National Law, as in force from time to time, set out in the Appendix to the Electronic Conveyancing (Adoption of National Law) Act 2012 of New South Wales is applied (with modifications) as a law of Tasmania by the Electronic Conveyancing (Adoption of National Law) Act 2013 and, as so applying, may be referred to as the Electronic Conveyancing National Law (Tasmania)

1. Commencement
    The provisions of the Electronic Conveyancing National Law were applied as a law of Tasmania on 19 November 2013.

2. Further information
    The full text of the Electronic Conveyancing National Law is set out in the Appendix to the Electronic Conveyancing (Adoption of National Law) Act 2012 of New South Wales (click on INFORMATION for a link to New South Wales legislation). See the Electronic Conveyancing (Adoption of National Law) Act 2013 for modifications to the Electronic Conveyancing National Law as it applies in Tasmania.
